properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 13 at 12:44PM EST until February 16 at 7:01PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the Congaree River...

Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland
Counties

.Moderate to high levels will continue on the Congaree River
near and downstream from Columbia because of local runoff and
additional releases from upstream reservoirs.

The Flood Advisory continues for
The Congaree River At Columbia.
* until further notice, or until the advisory is cancelled.
* At 12 PM Thursday the stage was 12.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 19 feet, and the Advisory stage begins at 10 feet.
* Forecast...The river may briefly drop below 10 feet this evening,
but is expected to fluctuate - with additional rises - near the
10 to 13 foot range during the next several days.
* At 13 feet...Flooding occurs in flood-prone areas near and
downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs over much of the
Cayce and West Columbia river walk.
* At 10 feet...Flooding begins in flood-prone areas near and
downstream from Columbia. Flooding also begins on parts of the
Cayce and West Columbia river walk.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means that nuisance flooding may occur nearest the
river when the level is below the official flood stage.
